review_title: Low stress, lots of opportunity for professional development
pros: Different departments are managed differently, the School of Cyber and Design Media is well run and focused. Not bogged down in pointless meetings.

job_title: Instructional Support Specialist in Augusta, GA
pros: The pay is really nice for a part time job, management is awesome, and I love my colleagues. It's impactful work too
cons: Since it's only part time, you need to supplement your income with something else or it isn't sustainable
Minimal room for growth beyond the position.

review_title: Augusta Is Growing in the Right Direction
pros: Predominately Black Institution, Small Campus, Growing in the Industry and the People are great!
cons: Leadership development need improvement, aesthetics of classroom settings, blending experiences for all students

job_title: Cyber Security Instructor in Augusta, GA
pros: Job security Predictable teaching environment Great co-workers I have never been on call or asked to work after hours The Georgia Cyber Center is a great location
cons: Limited flexibility in non-classroom work duties Instructor pay is not bad, but about half of what I was making in the industry Cyber department is isolated from the rest of the school Direction of the current leadership is general education

pros: They usually are good with flexible hours
cons: They look you over for a job in your own department

pros:
The people I work with are the best part of my job!
Leadership have open door policy.
cons: Not many opportunities to move up.

pros: Positive Environment, Reliable working schedules, opportunities to teach students from all ages and backgrounds,
cons: Not much room for professional growth

pros: Great place to work, good benefits and health care plan. If you enjoy helping students this is the atmosphere for you.
cons: Salary increases are tied to the state budget.  There were several years without increases due to budget cuts.

job_title: Former Electrical Program Substitute Instructor in Augusta, GA
pros: A no stress work environment and full supportive staff.
cons: Not any to think of beyond being a state employee.

job_title: Adjunct Cosmetology Instructor in Augusta, GA
pros: excellent career if working in a professional environment
cons: can go downhill if your team is not on the same page!!!!!

pros: most colleagues are friendly, department heads are great, administration
cons: no offices for adjuncts, paid only for classroom hours, workload too heavy, adjuncts given student email accounts
